item.title: Erica add a quote by Amy Fusselman
item.description: "I was feeling all fertile and blossoming there for a second. And now I just feel like me, on earth. I was floating a little bit there before. I was like a very small version of a Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade balloon. I was puffy and needed handlers. I was lumbering through the air, a couple inches off the ground. I was veering toward lampposts." -- Amy Fusselman

item.title: Erica add a quote by Deborah Eisenberg
item.description: "It's broadening. You meet people in your family you'd never happen to run into otherwise." -- Deborah Eisenberg

item.title: Erica add a quote by Emma Donoghue
item.description: "...sentences swallowed and sung back and swallowed all over again. She was made entirely out of words." -- Emma Donoghue

item.title: Erica add a quote by Kitty Burns Florey
item.description: "The language sticks to them like cat hair to black trousers, and they do things correctly without knowing why." -- Kitty Burns Florey

item.title: Erica add a quote by Michael Pollan
item.description: "Twenty thousand birds moved away from me as one, like a ground-hugging white cloud, clucking softly." -- Michael Pollan

item.title: Erica add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "You feel like telling him you're not single in the way that he thinks you're single. After all, you have yourself." -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Erica add a quote by Andrew Sean Greer
item.description: "...meaning his stuffed bear who was as real to him as his mother or me. Or else as imaginary." -- Andrew Sean Greer

item.title: Erica add a quote by Sarah Bird
item.description: "I shrug and smile amiably the way you do when you're in a foreign country and have no idea what anyone is saying, so you end up grinning and nodding your way into a three-way with a henna vendor and a camel." -- Sarah Bird

item.title: Erica add a quote by Laurence Gonzales
item.description: "With the illusion that we have dominion over the earth we conclude we have nothing to fear." -- Laurence Gonzales

item.title: Erica add a quote by Sebastian Faulks
item.description: "Lonely's like any other organism; competitive and resourceful in the struggle to perpetuate itself." -- Sebastian Faulks

item.title: Erica add a quote by Doug Fine
item.description: "No matter what happens to society, I must maintain my supply of ice cream. " -- Doug Fine

item.title: Erica add a quote by Kevin Kling
item.description: "We were talking about my dad, remembering him as vividly as possible as possible because we knew we weren’t going to get any knew memories. We were holding on to the old ones as tightly as we could." -- Kevin Kling

item.title: Erica add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Bod quite liked crows. He thought they were funny and he liked the way they helped to keep the graveyard tidy." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Erica add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "I wished she’d never stop squeezing me. I wished I could spend the rest of my life as a child, being slightly crushed by someone who loved me." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Erica add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Not surprisingly, the socks remain silent, as was their legal right." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Erica add a quote by Barbara Pym
item.description: "My thoughts went round and round and it occurred to me that if I ever wrote a novel it would be of the 'stream of consciousness' type and deal with an hour in the life of a woman at the sink." -- Barbara Pym

item.title: Erica add a quote by Barbara Pym
item.description: "Mimosa did lose its first freshness too quickly to be worth buying and I must not allow myself to have feelings, but must only observe the effects of other people's." -- Barbara Pym

item.title: Erica add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Then would you read a Sustaining Book, such as would help and comfort a Wedged Bear in Great Tightness." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Erica add a quote by Anna Camilleri
item.description: "She's the stuff that lava is made of, not rain." -- Anna Camilleri

item.title: Erica add a quote by Ivan E. Coyote
item.description: "We are carrying contraband words with us, memorized, tucked away in tattered journals and stored magically on disks in Anna's left pocket. Canadian words, queer words that we spoke on-stage for money in the land of the brave. With no valid permit, license, visa or contract to do so. Felons, really, all of us, and now we intended to flee the scene without paying income tax on the twelve dollars and fifty American cents we each made. It's just this kind of shameless law-breaking that gives all poets a bad name." -- Ivan E. Coyote

item.title: Erica add a quote by Novella Carpenter
item.description: "No one seemed to think it was odd that a Dumpster-diving urban pig farmer was in their midst. In fact, I came to learn that the restaurant industry was filled with other obsessive freaks like Samin, who would never buy a factory-made pickle. I was just another one of those freaks." -- Novella Carpenter

item.title: Erica add a quote by Stephen Elliott
item.description: "They both knew when it was appropriate to eat and how to give a compliment, and spent a lot of time saying hello and goodbye." -- Stephen Elliott

item.title: Erica add a quote by Stephen Elliott
item.description: "When we die our argument dies with us. The argument we never articulated well enough, that we were failed by our parents, and the schools, and the state. The cause of death is the missing safety net." -- Stephen Elliott

item.title: Erica add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "But then books, as I'm sure you know, seldom prompt a course of action. Books generally just confirm you in what you have, perhaps unwittingly, decided to do already. You go to a book to have your convictions corroborated. A book, as it were, closes the book. " -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Erica add a quote by Jacqueline Kelly
item.description: "Ahhh. Bed, book, kitten, sandwich. All one needed in life, really." -- Jacqueline Kelly

item.title: Erica add a quote by Jedediah Berry
item.description: "The world is unkind to the shoeless and frolicsome." -- Jedediah Berry

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lisa Scottoline
item.description: "Women shouldn't iron, ever. It's our wrinkles that make us interesting." -- Lisa Scottoline

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "She had expected a pistol to seem light and natural-a seamless extension of her angry feral self." -- Lorrie Moore

item.title: Erica add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "I have always loved the desert. One sits down on a desert sand dune, sees nothing, hears nothing. Yet through the silence something throbs, and gleams..." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Erica add a quote by Lynn Breedlove
item.description: "I learned in high school, if I hold up an effigy, a mask, or a lie, that mask will get all the love, not me." -- Lynn Breedlove
